title: Software Engineer, Backend
description:
**Let's build what's next, together.**
 We are Spotnana. We're on a mission to modernize the infrastructure of the $1\\.4 trillion travel industry to power the perfect trip for travelers everywhere. Our Travel\\-as\\-a\\-Service platform is designed to make every trip better, whether you're booking for work, building a travel tool, or looking to offer personalized experiences at scale.
   

  

 But we're not just modernizing tech, we're rethinking how the industry works. And to get there, we're bringing together innovative, ambitious, and open\\-minded people who want to build something that lasts.
   

  

 At Spotnana, our values and principles guide how we work and grow together:
   

  

* **Build the future** 
 – We are leaders, we are innovators, we are ambitious.
* **Commit to excellence** 
 – We're accountable, we are partners, we are agile.
* **Stronger together** 
 – We lead with respect and integrity, we are inclusive, we are lifelong learners.


**Who:** 
*You!* 
 And the rest of the Engineering department \\& their cross\\-functional partners
   

  

**What:** 
 A
 **Software Engineer, Backend** 
 position title and an outstanding Problem\\-solving \\& Collaboration skills
   

  

**When:** 
*ASAP!* 
 We are looking to hire and onboard a new hire as soon as we find the right person for the job. Exciting work awaits!
   

  

**Where:** 
 Hybrid: Our office hub location of
 **Bangalore** 
 – you will be required to be in office 1\\+ days per week in alignment with our office work policy.
   

  

**Why:** 
 Join our dynamic team and be a part of a mission\\-critical project that will propel Spotnana's growth and success! We're seeking versatile engineers with leadership qualities, a passion for problem\\-solving, and the enthusiasm to take on new challenges as we push the boundaries of technology. At Spotnana, we are an API\\-first company, leading the charge in innovative solutions.
   

  

**How** 
 (to land the job!)
 **:** 
 The process typically begins with an introductory call with a member of our Talent Acquisition team, where we'll discuss your background, career aspirations, and what makes Spotnana a great fit for you. Then a live virtual interview with a panel of engineers and hiring managers.
   

  

**The day\\-to\\-day:**
* Work alongside a team of brilliant engineers to design and develop high\\-quality cloud\\-native services within the Spotnana platform and products (it's like being part of a superhero squad, but for coding!)
* Take charge of ensuring customer delight within your area of impact. You have the power to make our users jump with joy!
* Embody and promote the best engineering practices and culture. You're like the Yoda of coding, guiding and mentoring others towards greatness.
* Become a coding superhero with code reviews and test automation for your modules. Unleash your powers to defend against bugs and glitches!
* Collaborate with architects and technical leads to bring craftsmanship and innovation to the forefront. Together, we'll create a product that will make heads turn and jaws drop!


**Skills \\& qualities we value:**
* Bachelor's or Master's degree in Engineering, Computer Science, or a related technical field. Exceptional candidates without formal education, but with the skills to rival even the most educated, are encouraged to apply. We value talent and passion above all!
* Experience in backend distributed server\\-side development within a cloud\\-native stack is formidable. Building frameworks for consumption is your secret weapon!
* 1\\-3 years of software development experience, battling with products and/or SaaS services. Your knowledge of data structures and algorithms is legendary!
* Experience with any programming language example Java/Python/C\\+\\+
* Experience in complex, matrixed organizations has prepared you for the challenges of working across teams and projects. You're a master of collaboration!
* Successfully assembled and nurtured full\\-stack engineering teams, bringing out the best in each member. You're a superhero team builder!


**Perks \\& benefits you will love**
 Spotnana strives to offer fair, industry\\-competitive, and equitable compensation. Our approach assesses total compensation, including cash, annual performance bonus, company equity, and comprehensive benefits.
   

  

 We care for the people who make everything possible \\- our benefits include:
   

  

* Comprehensive benefit plans covering medical for self, spouse, children and parents including free doctor consultations; employee assistance program effective on your hire date
* Group accidental coverage for all employees.
* 18 privilege leaves, 12 casual/sick leave days per year in addition to 12 company holidays with an open choice holidays, quarterly recharge/wellness days and an end\\-of\\-year company shutdown
* Up to 26 weeks of parental leave
* Monthly cell phone/internet stipend
* Meal allowance
* Wellness/gym reimbursement
* Employee retirement planning such as corporate NPS and EPF


 We are committed to fostering a diverse, inclusive environment and to encourage these values in everyone on our team. We provide an environment of mutual respect where opportunities are available without regard to race, color, religion, sex, pregnancy (including childbirth, lactation and related medical conditions), national origin, age, physical and mental disability, marital status, sexual orientation, gender identity, gender expression, genetic information (including characteristics and testing), military and veteran status, and any other characteristic protected by applicable law. We believe that diversity and inclusion for people from all walks of life is key to our success as a company.

title: Software Engineer – Frontend (Node,React)
description:
**Role: Software Engineer – Frontend (Node,React)**
**Key Responsibilities**
* Design \\& Develop: Architect and implement scalable, well\\-documented, and efficient code primarily in Frontend Technologies (Typescript, React)
* Feature Ownership: Take ownership of the full lifecycle of major features, from design and development to deployment including unit test cases, Specification dossier wherever it is applicable
* Collaboration: Collaborate with Airbus focal or counterparts to capture the requirements and keep the project management tracker uptodate
* Optimization: Identify and resolve performance and scaling challenges across the application stack.
* CI/CD: Champion best practices for continuous integration, continuous delivery (CI/CD), testing


**Required Skills \\& Qualifications**
* Core Language Proficiency: 5\\+ years of professional experience with a major programming language such as Typescript, REACT and Nodejs.
* Cloud \\& DevOps: Extensive experience with Cloud Platform (mainly GCP)
* Google API’s: Good working knowledge of using Google API’s in an application.
* OCP: Good understanding of OCP4\\.
* Testing: Commitment to rigorous testing (unit, integration, and end\\-to\\-end testing).


**Experience:** 
 5\\-8 Years
   

  

**Education:** 
 BE/B.Tech/MCA
   

  

**Employment Type** 
 : Full Time
   

  

**Location:** 
 Bengaluru
   

  

**Why Join ALTEN India?**
* Opportunity to work with leading global aerospace clients.
* Dynamic, innovation\\-driven environment with exposure to cutting\\-edge technologies.
* Continuous learning and career growth opportunities.
* Inclusive and collaborative workplace culture.

title: Quality assurance engineer
description:
Min\\-Max years of exp\\- 5\\+ years
   

  

 Top3 Mandatory skills\\- Automation (Selenium), UI path\\- MUST HAVE. Knowledge of payments. Banking domain exp is a must.
   

  

**Resource should be able to support for the below activities:**
* Requirement Analysis through BRD/FSD and creation of test scenarios and cases
* Test documents preparation\\- test plan, test strategy, status reports, test closure reports
* Test execution as part of ST, SIT, regression, UAT support
* Defect management and tracking with different teams
* Automate test cases on Edge and Chrome browser using selenium BDD framework (should have enough experience to create the flows from scratch)
* Effective logs management for manual and automated test cases


 Coordination with different supporting applications POCs for SIT execution

title: Staff Software Engineer
description:
The Ld Software Engineer independently engineers secure, scalable and reliable technology solutions to advance CMEG in the global marketplace and serve risk management needs of customers around the world.
   

  

**Principal Accountabilities**
* Conducts full system testing.
* Defines key metrics driving code optimization and leads discussion of code reviews; Manages environment build deployments, release notes and build notices; Reviews code to proactively identify and mitigate potential issues and defects as well as identify solution problems and issues outside code.
* Develops designs for all aspects of a project; Mentors seniors software engineers.
* Exhibits language proficiency and independently writes application modules and unit tests as well as designs independently. Contributes to architectural discussions. Interprets and enforces architecture for a development team. Mentors developers, and is influential within company division.
* Influences best practices development, contributing to process enhancements, and enforces best practices on project work.
* Proficient in SQL knowledge, intermediate in database modeling and skilled in database tuning.


**CME Group: Where Futures are Made**
 CME Group is the world’s leading derivatives marketplace. But who we are goes deeper than that. Here, you can impact markets worldwide. Transform industries. And build a career by shaping tomorrow. We invest in your success and you own it – all while working alongside a team of leading experts who inspire you in ways big and small. Problem solvers, difference makers, trailblazers. Those are our people. And we’re looking for more.
   

  

 At CME Group, we embrace our employees' unique experiences and skills to ensure that everyone’s perspectives are acknowledged and valued. As an equal\\-opportunity employer, we consider all potential employees without regard to any protected characteristic.
   

  

**Important Notice:** 
 Recruitment fraud is on the rise, with scammers using misleading promises of job offers and interviews to solicit money and personal information from job seekers. CME Group adheres to established procedures designed to maintain trust, confidence and security throughout our recruitment process. Learn more here.

title: Senior Test Automation Engineer
description:
Choosing Capgemini means choosing a company where you will be empowered to shape your career in the way you’d like, where you’ll be supported and inspired by a collaborative community of colleagues around the world, and where you’ll be able to reimagine what’s possible. Join us and help the world’s leading organizations unlock the value of technology and build a more sustainable, more inclusive world.
   

  

 Your Role
   

  

 We are looking for a detail\\-oriented and experienced QA Automation Engineer with strong expertise in API testing and automation. The ideal candidate will be responsible for designing, developing, and executing automated tests to ensure the reliability and performance of our backend services and APIs.
   

  

* Design and implement automated test suites for RESTful and GraphQL APIs.
* Develop reusable test frameworks using tools like Postman, REST Assured, Karate, or similar.


 We are looking for a detail\\-oriented and experienced QA Automation Engineer with strong expertise in API testing and automation. The ideal candidate will be responsible for designing, developing, and executing automated tests to ensure the reliability and performance of our backend services and APIs.
   

  

* Design and implement automated test suites for RESTful and GraphQL APIs.
* Develop reusable test frameworks using tools like Postman, REST Assured, Karate, or similar.


 Your Profile
   

  

* Validate API responses, status codes, headers, and payloads against business requirements.
* Integrate API tests into CI/CD pipelines (e.g., Jenkins, GitHub Actions, Azure DevOps).
* Collaborate with developers and QA team members to ensure comprehensive test coverage.
* Analyze test results, identify issues, and work with development teams to resolve them.
* Maintain documentation for test cases, test data, and automation frameworks.


**What You'll Love About Working With Us**
* We value flexibility and support a healthy work\\-life balance through remote and hybrid work options.
* Competitive compensation and benefits.
* Career development programs and certifications in cloud technologies.
* A diverse and inclusive workplace that fosters innovation and collaboration.


 Capgemini is a global business and technology transformation partner, helping organizations to accelerate their dual transition to a digital and sustainable world, while creating tangible impact for enterprises and society. It is a responsible and diverse group of 340,000 team members in more than 50 countries. With its strong over 55\\-year heritage, Capgemini is trusted by its clients to unlock the value of technology to address the entire breadth of their business needs. It delivers end\\-to\\-end services and solutions leveraging strengths from strategy and design to engineering, all fueled by its market leading capabilities in AI, generative AI, cloud and data, combined with its deep industry expertise and partner ecosystem.

title: Software Developer 4
description:
**Job Description**
 Are you ready to thrive in an environment where every day brings new challenges and opportunities to innovate? If you love tackling fast\\-paced, complex problems and delivering creative, high\\-impact solutions, this could be your perfect role!
   

  

 Join the renowned Database Sustaining Engineering team—the backbone of Oracle’s product excellence both in the Cloud and on\\-premises. As the trusted experts for diagnosing and resolving issues across virtually all Oracle Database Kernel stack, we’re at the forefront of maintaining, enhancing, and advancing mission\\-critical systems used by the world’s leading companies.
   

  

 What makes this team special?
   

  

* Real Impact, High Stakes: From keeping major airline, bank, and e\\-commerce platforms running to supporting nearly all Fortune 500 companies, our work matters. When the stakes are high, our team steps in to deliver swift, innovative solutions at the source code level—often with millions of dollars on the line.
* Constant Variety and Challenge: Every day is different. You’ll investigate unexpected product behaviors, deep\\-dive into complex codebases, collaborate with Oracle Support and Cloud Operations, and design enhancements that strengthen resilience and diagnostics in our products.
* See Immediate Results: There’s nothing quite like the satisfaction of restoring a critical system and knowing your work keeps global business moving.
* Learn from the Best: Join a dedicated team with a wealth of experience—many of our experts have been here over a decade—and continuously grow alongside them.
* Customer Focused: Our work is at the intersection of engineering and customer experience. You’ll develop a keen understanding of how our products are used in the real world, and your solutions will have a direct and visible impact on customer satisfaction and product quality.


 What are we looking for?
   

  

* Fast learners who are energized by complexity and ambiguity.
* Motivated problem\\-solvers who think creatively under pressure.
* Great communicators with a passion for technical excellence and customer success.
* Individuals eager for continuous growth in a high\\-impact, ever\\-evolving environment.


 If you’re seeking meaningful technical challenges and are excited by the opportunity to shape the future of Oracle’s world\\-class software, we’d love to meet you.
   

  

 Join us and never have a dull moment—your expertise will help power the systems that run the world!
   

  

**Responsibilities**
**Responsibilities:**
 Are you ready to make your mark at the core of Oracle’s groundbreaking Database technology? Join us and play a pivotal role in shaping the future of our industry\\-leading Cloud services!
   

  

* Drive Innovation \\& Impact: Tackle challenging improvements and resolve critical defects in the Database kernel stack—the heart of Oracle’s success—directly impacting Cloud solutions and millions of customers worldwide.
* Collaborate with the Best: Work alongside a dynamic team of passionate, high\\-achieving developers dedicated to delivering top\\-quality results on time, every time.
* End\\-to\\-End Ownership: Take charge of your own module, from design and implementation all the way through major enhancements and bug fixes.
* Deep Technical Exposure: Gain invaluable experience with product development processes, code deep dives, advanced testing strategies, and critical design decisions—while partnering with senior developers and architects from multiple teams.
* Shape the Future: Identify and champion new approaches for automating problem\\-solving, streamlining triage, and delivering smarter resolutions.
* Global Collaboration: Thrive in a truly international environment, collaborating across teams and sharing your work in high\\-visibility development forums.


 If you’re passionate about innovation, collaboration, and building the future of cloud\\-based and on\\-premise database solutions, we want to hear from you!
   

  

**Qualifications:**
* BE/ME or equivalent in Computer Science or an equivalent area.
* 7 to 10 years of software development experience.


**Required Skills:**
* Expert software development knowledge in C (or CPP) programming language, server/systems level experience in large enterprise class software.
* Excellent understanding of System Architecture and Implementation experience in working/released products with high complexity.
* Good Operating systems knowledge with concepts related to Processes, Memory Management (also Shared Memory), File Systems, TCP/IPC Networking concepts etc.
* Working knowledge of fault tolerant systems and ability to understand exception case handling.
* Excellent debugging and problem solving experience on Linux/Unix environments, along with ability to identify product improvements.
* Excellent analytical capabilities and logical reasoning skills.
* Working knowledge of processing large amount of product diagnostics/logs/traces to generate meaningful analytics.
* Knowledge of Project Management concepts/software (Jira, Sprints, etc.) and ability to multi\\-task and deal with shifting priorities.
* Should have excellent written (including product documentation) and verbal (with presentation) communication skills.


**Additional Preferred Skills:**
* Working Knowledge of C Compiler, instructions optimization, etc.
* Working experience in Database kernel internals.
* Working experience of Cloud environment and processes.
* Working experience in debugging basic networking problems and analyzing TCP dumps.


**Qualifications**
 Career Level \\- IC4
   

  

**About Us**
 As a world leader in cloud solutions, Oracle uses tomorrow’s technology to tackle today’s challenges. We’ve partnered with industry\\-leaders in almost every sector—and continue to thrive after 40\\+ years of change by operating with integrity.
   

  

 We know that true innovation starts when everyone is empowered to contribute. That’s why we’re committed to growing an inclusive workforce that promotes opportunities for all.
   

  

 Oracle careers open the door to global opportunities where work\\-life balance flourishes. We offer competitive benefits based on parity and consistency and support our people with flexible medical, life insurance, and retirement options. We also encourage employees to give back to their communities through our volunteer programs.
   

  

 We’re committed to including people with disabilities at all stages of the employment process. If you require accessibility assistance or accommodation for a disability at any point, let us know by emailing accommodation\\-request\\_mb@oracle.com or by calling \\+1 888 404 2494 in the United States.
   

  

 Oracle is an Equal Employment Opportunity Employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, national origin, sexual orientation, gender identity, disability and protected veterans’ status, or any other characteristic protected by law. Oracle will consider for employment qualified applicants with arrest and conviction records pursuant to applicable law.

title: Developer Relations Engineer
description:
About the role
 



 RunAnywhere is building the infrastructure \\+ SDK to run AI fully on\\-device (LLMs, STT, TTS, VLM) across iOS, Android, React Native, and Flutter with optional cloud fallback. We’re hiring a Developer Relations Engineer who can ship real apps, turn them into clean demos, and tell the story on Twitter/X \\+ LinkedIn.
 



 This is not a community\\-only role. You’ll be writing code, debugging mobile builds, and publishing sample apps developers can copy.
 



  





 What you’ll do
 


* Build demo apps using RunAnywhere SDKs (voice agents, offline chat, on\\-device STT/TTS, etc.)
* Ship high\\-quality sample repos: quickstarts, templates, walkthroughs, short demo videos
* Create outbound content consistently (threads/posts \\+ launch\\-style demos) grounded in real builds
* Improve developer onboarding: fix docs/examples, file PRs/issues, remove setup friction
* Partner with founders/engineering to turn features into launchable narratives (latency, offline reliability, benchmarks)



 Must\\-haves
 


* Strong engineer who can build and ship
* Hands\\-on experience with at least one: Swift / Kotlin / React Native / Flutter
* Can debug real mobile problems (deps, builds, performance/memory)
* Proof you can communicate: GitHub \\+ content or demos
* Comfortable moving fast as “customer zero”



 Nice to have
 


* On\\-device / AI experience (LLMs, STT/TTS pipelines, latency/benchmarking)
* Open source, SDK/dev tooling experience, video demo comfort



 Success in 30–60 days
 


* Ship 7\\-8 standout demo apps \\+ clean READMEs
* Publish 4\\-6 posts/week tied to real demos
* Noticeably reduce onboarding friction in docs/examples



 To apply
 



 Send (1\\) GitHub/portfolio, (2\\) 2–3 links to technical content/demos, (3\\) your strongest platform (iOS/Android/RN/Flutter) \\+ what you’d build first with RunAnywhere.
 



  





 Posting on YC: https://www.ycombinator.com/companies/runanywhere/jobs/SZGT7Wb\\-developer\\-relations\\-engineer\\-devrel\\-who\\-can\\-actually\\-ship

title: Software Developer 4
description:
**Job Description**
 Are you ready to thrive in an environment where every day brings new challenges and opportunities to innovate? If you love tackling fast\\-paced, complex problems and delivering creative, high\\-impact solutions, this could be your perfect role!
   

  

 Join the renowned Database Sustaining Engineering team—the backbone of Oracle’s product excellence both in the Cloud and on\\-premises. As the trusted experts for diagnosing and resolving issues across virtually all Oracle Database Kernel stack, we’re at the forefront of maintaining, enhancing, and advancing mission\\-critical systems used by the world’s leading companies.
   

  

 What makes this team special?
   

  

* Real Impact, High Stakes: From keeping major airline, bank, and e\\-commerce platforms running to supporting nearly all Fortune 500 companies, our work matters. When the stakes are high, our team steps in to deliver swift, innovative solutions at the source code level—often with millions of dollars on the line.
* Constant Variety and Challenge: Every day is different. You’ll investigate unexpected product behaviors, deep\\-dive into complex codebases, collaborate with Oracle Support and Cloud Operations, and design enhancements that strengthen resilience and diagnostics in our products.
* See Immediate Results: There’s nothing quite like the satisfaction of restoring a critical system and knowing your work keeps global business moving.
* Learn from the Best: Join a dedicated team with a wealth of experience—many of our experts have been here over a decade—and continuously grow alongside them.
* Customer Focused: Our work is at the intersection of engineering and customer experience. You’ll develop a keen understanding of how our products are used in the real world, and your solutions will have a direct and visible impact on customer satisfaction and product quality.


 What are we looking for?
   

  

* Fast learners who are energized by complexity and ambiguity.
* Motivated problem\\-solvers who think creatively under pressure.
* Great communicators with a passion for technical excellence and customer success.
* Individuals eager for continuous growth in a high\\-impact, ever\\-evolving environment.


 If you’re seeking meaningful technical challenges and are excited by the opportunity to shape the future of Oracle’s world\\-class software, we’d love to meet you.
   

  

 Join us and never have a dull moment—your expertise will help power the systems that run the world!
   

  

**Responsibilities**
**Responsibilities:**
 Are you ready to make your mark at the core of Oracle’s groundbreaking Database technology? Join us and play a pivotal role in shaping the future of our industry\\-leading Cloud services!
   

  

* Drive Innovation \\& Impact: Tackle challenging improvements and resolve critical defects in the Database kernel stack—the heart of Oracle’s success—directly impacting Cloud solutions and millions of customers worldwide.
* Collaborate with the Best: Work alongside a dynamic team of passionate, high\\-achieving developers dedicated to delivering top\\-quality results on time, every time.
* End\\-to\\-End Ownership: Take charge of your own module, from design and implementation all the way through major enhancements and bug fixes.
* Deep Technical Exposure: Gain invaluable experience with product development processes, code deep dives, advanced testing strategies, and critical design decisions—while partnering with senior developers and architects from multiple teams.
* Shape the Future: Identify and champion new approaches for automating problem\\-solving, streamlining triage, and delivering smarter resolutions.
* Global Collaboration: Thrive in a truly international environment, collaborating across teams and sharing your work in high\\-visibility development forums.


 If you’re passionate about innovation, collaboration, and building the future of cloud\\-based and on\\-premise database solutions, we want to hear from you!
   

  

**Qualifications:**
* BE/ME or equivalent in Computer Science or an equivalent area.
* 7 to 10 years of software development experience.


**Required Skills:**
* Expert software development knowledge in C (or CPP) programming language, server/systems level experience in large enterprise class software.
* Excellent understanding of System Architecture and Implementation experience in working/released products with high complexity.
* Good Operating systems knowledge with concepts related to Processes, Memory Management (also Shared Memory), File Systems, TCP/IPC Networking concepts etc.
* Working knowledge of fault tolerant systems and ability to understand exception case handling.
* Excellent debugging and problem solving experience on Linux/Unix environments, along with ability to identify product improvements.
* Excellent analytical capabilities and logical reasoning skills.
* Working knowledge of processing large amount of product diagnostics/logs/traces to generate meaningful analytics.
* Knowledge of Project Management concepts/software (Jira, Sprints, etc.) and ability to multi\\-task and deal with shifting priorities.
* Should have excellent written (including product documentation) and verbal (with presentation) communication skills.


**Additional Preferred Skills:**
* Working Knowledge of C Compiler, instructions optimization, etc.
* Working experience in Database kernel internals.
* Working experience of Cloud environment and processes.
* Working experience in debugging basic networking problems and analyzing TCP dumps.


**Qualifications**
 Career Level \\- IC4
   

  

**About Us**
 As a world leader in cloud solutions, Oracle uses tomorrow’s technology to tackle today’s challenges. We’ve partnered with industry\\-leaders in almost every sector—and continue to thrive after 40\\+ years of change by operating with integrity.
   

  

 We know that true innovation starts when everyone is empowered to contribute. That’s why we’re committed to growing an inclusive workforce that promotes opportunities for all.
   

  

 Oracle careers open the door to global opportunities where work\\-life balance flourishes. We offer competitive benefits based on parity and consistency and support our people with flexible medical, life insurance, and retirement options. We also encourage employees to give back to their communities through our volunteer programs.
   

  

 We’re committed to including people with disabilities at all stages of the employment process. If you require accessibility assistance or accommodation for a disability at any point, let us know by emailing accommodation\\-request\\_mb@oracle.com or by calling \\+1 888 404 2494 in the United States.
   

  

 Oracle is an Equal Employment Opportunity Employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, national origin, sexual orientation, gender identity, disability and protected veterans’ status, or any other characteristic protected by law. Oracle will consider for employment qualified applicants with arrest and conviction records pursuant to applicable law.

title: Google Appscript Developer
description:
**Role: Google Appscript Developer**
**Key Responsibilities**
* Develop and maintain automation workflows using Google Apps Script
* Customize and extend Google Workspace applications (Sheets, Docs, Forms, Gmail, Drive)
* Build integrations between Google Workspace, databases, and third\\-party systems
* Develop backend scripts and utilities using Python and JavaScript
* Write and optimize SQL queries for data extraction, transformation, and reporting
* Integrate AWS services with applications (Lambda, S3, API Gateway, etc.)
* Design and maintain APIs and web apps using Apps Script and related technologies
* Debug, optimize, and enhance performance of scripts and applications
* Collaborate with stakeholders to gather requirements and deliver solutions
* Document solutions, workflows, and technical designs


**Required Skills \\& Qualifications**
* Strong hands\\-on experience with Google Apps Script
* Proficiency in JavaScript and working knowledge of Python
* Solid understanding of SQL and database concepts
* Experience or exposure to AWS services
* Experience building APIs and system integrations
* Good understanding of security, authentication, and access controls
* Strong problem\\-solving and analytical skills
* Good communication and documentation abilities


**Experience:** 
 4\\-6 Years
   

  

**Education:** 
 BE/B.Tech/MCA

 : Full Time
   

  

**Location:** 
 Bengaluru

 0\\-15 Days

* Opportunity to work with leading global aerospace clients.

* Inclusive and collaborative workplace culture.

title: Developer - Skywise(Palantir Foundry)
description:
**Role : Developer – Skywise (Palantir Foundry)**
**Key Responsibilities**
* Ability to collaborate with a diversity of customer teams to address important issues and to resolve them.
* Experienced in collaborating with internal and external stakeholders, adaptation and learning of the business processes speak of the customer
* Experienced in working within a product delivery lifecycle, Agile/scrum experience in software development (plus).
* Produce high quality, well tested and documented source code.
* Assemble and edit source code repositories to develop a software stack for the product needs.
* Respects the standards and structure of the given APIs.
* Works closely with customers in line with Agile Scrum/DevOps ways of working (e.g. gathering requirements, creating technical specifications and architecture documents, creating good documentation, managing a project timeline).
* Develops design specifications and parameters that are in compliance with products’ architectural blueprints.
* Track record of successfully deploying and managing configuration management systems
* Participates in all phases of the product development lifecycle, including the analysis, design, test and integration of products.
* Researches, evaluates, and develops new tools to improve product development efficiency.
* Deploys highly available, scalable, maintainable, monitored systems and services.
* Manages the adoption of tooling and industry best practices among development teams
* Assist in development of product user manuals


**Required Skills \\& Qualifications**
* Engineering graduate (preferably in Computer Science) with 2 to 4 years of experience in Python, Javascript and Typescript, Data Analytics, Spark, SQL, Skywise and HTML\\-CSS(React is also good).
* Experience in building data pipelines using Apache Spark.
* Experience in building dashboards.
* Certification in Skywise/Palantir Foundry is a plus.
* Certification in Data Analytics is a plus.
* Knowledge / Experience in Skywise tools like Code Repositories, Code Workbooks, Ontologies, Slate, Workshop is a must.
* Knowledge / Experience in Pyspark is a must.
* Knowledge/ Experience in Kafka and other streaming tools is a plus.
* Knowledge/Experience in Foundry AIP(Artifi cial Intelligence Platform) platform is good to have.
* Knowledge / Experience on DevOps CICD Jenkins pipelines would be appreciated
* Strong knowledge of UI development using React with TypeScript
* Strong understanding of non\\-relational databases
* Ability to design and implement RESTful APIs
* Understanding of the Container technologies like Docker and Kubernetes
* Understanding of Microservices development
* Knowledge of test frameworks like Vitest and JUnit
* Strong knowledge of VCS or SCM tools like Git.
* Knowledge of SAFe agile methodology and workflow, preferably using JIRA


**Experience: 5\\-8 Years**
* Education: BE/B.Tech/ME/M.Tech/MCA (CS/IT)
* Employment Type: Full Time
* Location: Bengaluru
* Availability:0\\-15 Days
* Why Join ALTEN India?
* Opportunity to work with leading global aerospace clients.
* Dynamic, innovation\\-driven environment with exposure to cutting\\-edge technologies.
* Continuous learning and career growth opportunities.
* Inclusive and collaborative workplace culture.

title: IBM Sterling File Gateway
description:
Choosing Capgemini means choosing a company where you will be empowered to shape your career in the way you’d like, where you’ll be supported and inspired by a collaborative community of colleagues around the world, and where you’ll be able to reimagine what’s possible. Join us and help the world’s leading organizations unlock the value of technology and build a more sustainable, more inclusive world.
   

  

 Your Role
   

  

   
   

  

* Assist in the development and support of IBM Sterling File Gateway (SFG) amd connect:Direct


   
   

  

* Help configure file transfer protocols (e.g., SFTP, FTP/S, HTTPS,MQ, AS2 etc)


   
   

  

* Participate in partner onboarding activities, including setting up trading partner profiles and certificates


   
   

  

* Monitor and log file transfer activity and respond to file delivery issues under guidance


   
   

  

* Maintain technical documentation and assist with compliance audits


   
   

  

* Work closely with senior developers and integration analysts to meet project goals


 Your Profile
   

  

   
   

  

* Experience with IBM Sterling File Gateway or similar integration/file transfer platforms


   
   

  

* Understanding of file transfer protocols: SFTP, FTP/S, HTTPS, AS2, etc.


   
   

  

* Exposure to IBM Sterling B2B Integrator, Control Center, or Connect:Direct


   
   

  

* Familiarity with file encryption/decryption concepts


   
   

  

* Good troubleshooting and communication skills


   
   

  

* Willingness to learn and take on new technical challenges


   
   

  

* Bachelor’s degree in Computer Science, Information Systems, or a related field, or equivalent work experience


**What You'll Love About Working Here**
* We’re committed to ensure that people of all backgrounds feel encouraged and have a sense of belonging at Capgemini. You are valued for who you are, and you can bring your original self to work.
* Every Monday, kick off the week with a musical performance by our in\\-house band \\- The Rubber Band. Also get to participate in internal sports events, yoga challenges, or marathons.
* At Capgemini, you can work on cutting\\-edge projects in tech and engineering with industry leaders or create solutions to overcome societal and environmental challenges.


 Capgemini is an AI\\-powered global business and technology transformation partner, delivering tangible business value. We imagine the future of organizations and make it real with AI, technology and people. With our strong heritage of nearly 60 years, we are a responsible and diverse group of 420,000 team members in more than 50 countries. We deliver end\\-to\\-end services and solutions with our deep industry expertise and strong partner ecosystem, leveraging our capabilities across strategy, technology, design, engineering and business operations. The Group reported 2024 global revenues of €22\\.1 billion.
   

  

 Make it real \\| www.capgemini.com

title: Service Engineer, Digital Assets
description:
The Senior Engineer, Digital Assets is a hands‑on role responsible for designing, building, digital‑asset platform components—spanning the foundation platform, tokenised deposits, on‑chain payments, asset tokenisation, and institutional‑grade digital custody. Working within cross‑functional product squads, the role partners closely with Business as well as stakeholders.
   

  

**Qualifications \\& Experience**
* 7\\+ years in technology or product delivery within banking/financial services; 3\\+ years in blockchain, digital assets, or real‑time payments; Bachelor’s in CS/IT/Engineering (Master’s preferred).
* Certifications valued: Cloud (AWS/Azure/GCP), Enterprise Architecture (TOGAF), Security (CISSP/CISM), Blockchain/DLT (Hyperledger, Corda, CBP), Agile (PMI‑ACP/Scrum).
* 2\\+ year experience in one of the major programming languages like Java, .Net , Python
* Deep knowledge of DLT platforms and smart contracts; expertise in custody architectures, HSM/MPC, and key ceremonies.
* Proficiency in secure integration patterns (APIs, event streaming/Kafka), encryption standards (TLS/PGP), and key management.
* Experience with performance tuning, throughput optimisation, and operational resilience for distributed platforms.
* Excellent stakeholder management, executive communication, and vendor governance; data‑driven decision‑making.
